quotes: She holds a Ph.D. in Energy Planning and was Brazil’s Minister of the Environment from 2010 to 2016.
From 2008 to 2010, she was the Deputy Minister of the Environment.
In 2015, Teixeira was Head of the Brazilian Delegation on negotiations of the Paris Agreement of the UN Convention on Climate Change.
For her outstanding career, in 2013 Teixeira received the United Nations Environment Program “Champions of the Earth” award for Policy Leadership.

organizations.name: PPG7
quotes: Teixeira’s international experience comes from the negotiation and management of international projects in Brazil, such as PPG7.

organizations.name: UN’s High-Level Panel on Global Sustainability
quotes: By invitation of the UN’s Secretary General, she was a member of the High-Level Panel on Global Sustainability.

organizations.name: UN’s Rio+20 Conference on Sustainable Development
quotes: She was also a key leader of the 2012 UN’s Rio+20 Conference on Sustainable Development.

organizations.name: UN’s High-Level Panel on the Post-2015 Development Agenda (SDG’s Agenda 2030)
quotes: After Rio+20 she was again appointed by the UN’s Secretary-General as a member of the High-Level Panel on the Post-2015 Development Agenda (SDG’s Agenda 2030).

organizations.name: UN Convention on Climate Change
quotes: In 2015, Teixeira was Head of the Brazilian Delegation on negotiations of the Paris Agreement of the UN Convention on Climate Change.

organizations.name: United Nations Environment Program
quotes: For her outstanding career, in 2013 Teixeira received the United Nations Environment Program “Champions of the Earth” award for Policy Leadership.

organizations.name: International Resource Panel–IRP/UNEP-ONU
quotes: Today, she is Co-Chair of the International Resource Panel–IRP/UNEP-ONU, a Board Member of UN DESA, a member of the Administrative Council of the National Bank for Economic and Social Development (BNDES), a Senior Fellow of Institute Arapyaú, a Counselor of the Fernando Henrique Cardoso Foundation, Trustee Emeritus for Environment and Climate Change of Brazilian Center for International Relations-CEBRI, and a member of the Global Commission on the Geopolitics of Energy Transformation of IRENA.

Dr. Izabella Mônica Vieira Teixeira is a native Brazilian.
Teixeira’s international experience comes from the negotiation and management of international projects in Brazil, such as PPG7.
